content.en: Energy load forecasting: Researchers have investigated the use of various algorithms to accurately forecast electricity loads and predict energy consumption. The findings suggest that models such as the Adaptive Network Based Fuzzy Inference System (ANFIS), PSO-based improved Wang-Mendel (WM) method, and hybrid genetic algorithm-adaptive network-based fuzzy inference system (GA-ANFIS) outperform other models and algorithms in terms of forecasting accuracy. These algorithms have the ability to optimize energy demand forecasting, enhance learning and data mining abilities, and improve the accuracy of load predictions, making them promising tools for energy forecasting and optimization.
content.da: Energibelastningsprognose: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af forskellige algoritmer til nøjagtigt at forudsige elektricitetbelastninger og forudsige energiforbrug. Resultaterne tyder på, at modeller som Adaptive Network Based Fuzzy Inference System (ANFIS), PSO-baseret forbedret Wang-Mendel (WM) metode og hybrid genetisk algoritme-adaptive network-based fuzzy inference system (GA-ANFIS) overgår andre modeller og algoritmer med hensyn til prognosepræcision. Disse algoritmer har evnen til at optimere energiefterspørgselsprognoser, forbedre lærings- og dataminingevner samt øge præcisionen af belastningsprognoser, hvilket gør dem til lovende værktøjer til energiprognoser og -optimering.
